file_content.text: I don't want any more trouble. I'll tell you everything I know.
The Devaronian said a bounty hunter shot down his starship. He walked across the desert to reach Mos Ila. Blasted lucky he made it.
Tyresius has a bad habit of surviving.
Lucky fits his description.
Not just that--he can turn around even the worst luck. I've seen it.
Did he say where he abandoned his starship?
Across the desert?
No, but he wanted us to help get it running again. That plan changed real sudden-like, though.
Where did Tyresius scrounge up this bucket of bolts?
Who'd he con to get this ship?
That was the most amazing thing I've ever seen.
This bounty hunter caught up to us. Nasty little Rodian. Before we could draw blasters, the Devaronian cuts a deal.
Not only did he buy off the bounty hunter, he convinced him to sell his own starship!
Where did the bounty hunter go after selling his ship to Tyresius?
Then the Rodian is still here.
Tyresius is good, I'll give him that.
That's amazing.
Good? He negotiates better than a Jedi mind trick!
Some bounty hunters have no sense of professionalism.
That dishonorable scum.
It's all about the credits, right? Why else do any of us do this?
The Rodian's celebrating with a private party at a club outside of town. He's throwing around credits like sand.
I cross-referenced the ship's registration with known Rodian bounty hunters. Found your rival.
Veeboo Lunx. Deadly accurate with a blaster, but has a reputation for laziness. I'm surprised he made it this far.
He won't be going any further.
He's done.
Laziness would explain why he sold out so easily.
Guess he's tired of working.
I'd be curious to hear his side of the story, assuming you don't just blast him.
Hunters like him give the rest of us a bad name.
I hate useless bums.
But on the bright side, they make pros like us look great.
If Tyresius bought off your rival once, he might try it again. Use a bounty hunter to fight a bounty hunter?
That's useful information, right? Please, let me go. This was never personal.
Maybe the Devaronian went there to cut another deal? Please, let me go. This wasn't personal.
If I ever see you again, you're a dead man.
Run and don't look back.
You got it. I'm officially retired.
You can leave.
Don't have to tell me twice!
Good idea, letting him live. He'll warn the other mercenaries to stay out of our way.
Gonna find a ship and sign on as a deckhand....
Trying to kill me is always personal.
Yes it was. [Kill him]
Knew I'd regret... this stupid job....
Kind of harsh, don't you think? He told you everything he knew.
He might've been lying.
Couldn't be sure.
Great then, might as well kill the whole galaxy.
He still tried to kill us.
He deserved it.
Sure, but that was before he got to know us.
I kill anybody I want, understand?
It was my choice, got it?
Fine, kill everybody if it makes you happy. Er, everybody except me.
Let's drop in on your rival hunter's big party. It's the only lead we've got.
Hate... bounty... hunters....
Stop! I surrender! I've got no loyalty to that scum. He left us here to die.
The pay is great, but he never said we'd go up against anything like you.
You want to live? Tell me where Tyresius went.
Where did he go?
Define "great."
Ten times our usual rate. He was desperate. Now I know why.
You picked the wrong employer, pal.
You messed up.
No kidding. Should've stuck to pirating.
Got nothing to say. Beat it.
